intro: Hieraciodes lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are often clustered in a raceme. Hieraciodes lyrata is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
